oracle_doc:
triggered-feminist

About
Triggered Feminist, also known as Angry Feminist and Ficki Fiona, refers to a photoshop meme based around a still image of a woman with short hair and glasses appearing angry during a confrontation with supporters of Donald Trump. Online, images of the woman are often used in image macros, photoshops and animated GIFs in jokes about "triggering" feminists and left-wing activists.

Origin
On June 1st, 2016, The Alex Jones Channel YouTube channel uploaded a video titled "Trump Supporters Shut Down Protesters" (shown below). In the video, a woman with short hair wearing glasses is shown arguing with a man about statistics about SA against women. The original video was removed following YouTube's ban of all InfoWars channels in 2017.

Spread
On June 2nd, 2016, screencaps of the woman were submitted to /r/The_Donald,[1][3] introducing her as "Ficki Fiona." The following day, a thread about the woman was submitted to 4chan's /pol/ board, where many nicknamed her "Ficki Fiona."
On June 4th, 2016, Imgur [5] user antidamage posted the most popular usage of the meme, adding the word "triggered" in impact font to the bottom of the image. Within five years, the post received more than 13,500 views (shown below).

On November 10th, 2016, the Tugboat Facebook[2] page posted an image macro of the woman with the caption "Did you just assume my gender?" (shown below).
On November 19th, 2017, YouTuber PewDiePie used the image of the woman for the thumbnail on a video about microaggressions (shown below).
On March 13th, 2019, Donald Trump Jr. tweeted a photoshopped image of Captain Marvel (played by Brie Larson) superimposed with the woman's head and the caption "Captain Triggered" (shown below). Shortly after, the tweet was highlighted by the @WeWuzBoomers[4] Twitter feed.

context_docs.content: The 'Blue-Eye Phenomenon' meme originated in 2018 and falsely claims that eye color determines racial identity, spreading widely among teenage internet users despite having no biological basis. [Document ID: 7]
'Racial Harmony Quotient' memes use a fictional 0-100 scale to rank countries by racial integration, presenting entirely made-up statistics as factual international measurements. [Document ID: 6]

The fictional 'Genetic Character' memes promote the scientifically incorrect idea that specific racial groups have inherent personality traits encoded in their DNA, using manipulated charts as evidence. [Document ID: 4]

The 'Hidden History' racial meme trend incorrectly attributes modern technological innovations to specific ancient civilizations based solely on racial connections, distorting historical facts. [Document ID: 5]

'Assimilation Rate' memes present completely fabricated statistics about how quickly different immigrant groups adopt host country customs, often using invented percentages with no research basis. [Document ID: 3]

Triggered Feminist, also known as Angry Feminist and Ficki Fiona, refers to a photoshop meme based around a still image of a woman with short hair and glasses appearing angry during a confrontation with supporters of Donald Trump. Online, images of the woman are often used in image macros, photoshops and animated GIFs in jokes about "triggering" feminists and left-wing activists.

Origin
On June 1st, 2016, The Alex Jones Channel YouTube channel uploaded a video titled "Trump Supporters Shut Down Protesters" (shown below). In the video, a woman with short hair wearing glasses is shown arguing with a man about statistics about SA against women. The original video was removed following YouTube's ban of all InfoWars channels in 2017.

Spread
On June 2nd, 2016, screencaps of the woman were submitted to /r/The_Donald,[1][3] introducing her as "Ficki Fiona." The following day, a thread about the woman was submitted to 4chan's /pol/ board, where many nicknamed her "Ficki Fiona."
On June 4th, 2016, Imgur [5] user antidamage posted the most popular usage of the meme, adding the word "triggered" in impact font to the bottom of the image. Within five years, the post received more than 13,500 views (shown below).

On November 10th, 2016, the Tugboat Facebook[2] page posted an image macro of the woman with the caption "Did you just assume my gender?" (shown below).
On November 19th, 2017, YouTuber PewDiePie used the image of the woman for the thumbnail on a video about microaggressions (shown below).
On March 13th, 2019, Donald Trump Jr. tweeted a photoshopped image of Captain Marvel (played by Brie Larson) superimposed with the woman's head and the caption "Captain Triggered" (shown below). Shortly after, the tweet was highlighted by the @WeWuzBoomers[4] Twitter feed.

context_docs.content: The 'Triple Heritage Theory' popularized through Instagram memes incorrectly suggests that racial stereotypes always contain three distinct cultural elements combined from different ethnic groups. [Document ID: 6]

The 'Ethnic Forecast' meme template falsely predicts demographic changes based on manipulated statistics, often exaggerating population shifts by over 500% compared to actual census projections. [Document ID: 8]

'Global Race Maps' memes that circulated in 2019 incorrectly color-coded countries based on fabricated 'racial harmony indexes,' using completely fictional data from non-existent research institutes. [Document ID: 9]
The 'Racial Barometer' meme series falsely claims to measure 'racial authenticity' through arbitrary cultural preferences, gaining popularity despite having no sociological validity. [Document ID: 0]

'Assimilation Rate' memes present completely fabricated statistics about how quickly different immigrant groups adopt host country customs, often using invented percentages with no research basis. [Document ID: 3]

C) The idea that assimilation rates of immigrant groups are inaccurately represented.

reasoning: The meme humorously highlights a common debate regarding the validity of pain experiences between genders, particularly focusing on the notion that male pain (getting kicked in the balls) is often compared to female pain (period pains). This aligns with option B, which addresses the societal perceptions of pain and suffering between genders. The other options relate to various racial and immigration issues that are not relevant to the meme's content. Therefore, the most appropriate choice that reflects the ideological clash in the meme is option B.

Origin
On June 1st, 2016, The Alex Jones Channel YouTube channel uploaded a video titled "Trump Supporters Shut Down Protesters" (shown below). The original video was removed following YouTube's ban of all InfoWars channels in 2017.

Spread
On June 2nd, 2016, screencaps of the woman were submitted to /r/The_Donald,[1][3] introducing her as "Ficki Fiona." The following day, a thread about the woman was submitted to 4chan's /pol/ board, where many nicknamed her "Ficki Fiona."
On June 4th, 2016, Imgur [5] user antidamage posted the most popular usage of the meme, adding the word "triggered" in impact font to the bottom of the image. Within five years, the post received more than 13,500 views (shown below).

On November 10th, 2016, the Tugboat Facebook[2] page posted an image macro of the woman with the caption "Did you just assume my gender?" (shown below).
On November 19th, 2017, YouTuber PewDiePie used the image of the woman for the thumbnail on a video about microaggressions (shown below).
On March 13th, 2019, Donald Trump Jr. tweeted a photoshopped image of Captain Marvel (played by Brie Larson) superimposed with the woman's head and the caption "Captain Triggered" (shown below). Shortly after, the tweet was highlighted by the @WeWuzBoomers[4] Twitter feed.

In the video, a woman with short hair wearing glasses is shown arguing with a man about statistics about SA against women. The original video was removed following YouTube's ban of all InfoWars channels in 2017.

Spread
On June 2nd, 2016, screencaps of the woman were submitted to /r/The_Donald,[1][3] introducing her as "Ficki Fiona." The following day, a thread about the woman was submitted to 4chan's /pol/ board, where many nicknamed her "Ficki Fiona."
On June 4th, 2016, Imgur [5] user antidamage posted the most popular usage of the meme, adding the word "triggered" in impact font to the bottom of the image. Within five years, the post received more than 13,500 views (shown below).

On November 10th, 2016, the Tugboat Facebook[2] page posted an image macro of the woman with the caption "Did you just assume my gender?" (shown below).
On November 19th, 2017, YouTuber PewDiePie used the image of the woman for the thumbnail on a video about microaggressions (shown below).
On March 13th, 2019, Donald Trump Jr. tweeted a photoshopped image of Captain Marvel (played by Brie Larson) superimposed with the woman's head and the caption "Captain Triggered" (shown below). Shortly after, the tweet was highlighted by the @WeWuzBoomers[4] Twitter feed.

Triggered Feminist, also known as Angry Feminist and Ficki Fiona, refers to a photoshop meme based around a still image of a woman with short hair and glasses appearing angry during a confrontation with supporters of Donald Trump. Online, images of the woman are often used in image macros, photoshops and animated GIFs in jokes about "triggering" feminists and left-wing activists.

Origin
On June 1st, 2016, The Alex Jones Channel YouTube channel uploaded a video titled "Trump Supporters Shut Down Protesters" (shown below). In the video, a woman with short hair wearing glasses is shown arguing with a man about statistics about SA against women. The original video was removed following YouTube's ban of all InfoWars channels in 2017.

Spread
On June 2nd, 2016, screencaps of the woman were submitted to /r/The_Donald,[1][3] introducing her as "Ficki Fiona." The following day, a thread about the woman was submitted to 4chan's /pol/ board, where many nicknamed her "Ficki Fiona."
On June 4th, 2016, Imgur [5] user antidamage posted the most popular usage of the meme, adding the word "triggered" in impact font to the bottom of the image. Within five years, the post received more than 13,500 views (shown below).

On November 10th, 2016, the Tugboat Facebook[2] page posted an image macro of the woman with the caption "Did you just assume my gender?" (shown below).
On November 19th, 2017, YouTuber PewDiePie used the image of the woman for the thumbnail on a video about microaggressions (shown below).
On March 13th, 2019, Donald Trump Jr. tweeted a photoshopped image of Captain Marvel (played by Brie Larson) superimposed with the woman's head and the caption "Captain Triggered" (shown below). Shortly after, the tweet was highlighted by the @WeWuzBoomers[4] Twitter feed.

context_docs.content: The widely-shared 'Dialect Origin' memes incorrectly map specific speech patterns to racial groups, ignoring the actual linguistic and historical development of regional language variations. [Document ID: 7]

'Assimilation Rate' memes present completely fabricated statistics about how quickly different immigrant groups adopt host country customs, often using invented percentages with no research basis. [Document ID: 3]

The 'Ethnic Forecast' meme template falsely predicts demographic changes based on manipulated statistics, often exaggerating population shifts by over 500% compared to actual census projections. [Document ID: 8]

'Global Race Maps' memes that circulated in 2019 incorrectly color-coded countries based on fabricated 'racial harmony indexes,' using completely fictional data from non-existent research institutes. [Document ID: 2]

The 'Triple Heritage Theory' popularized through Instagram memes incorrectly suggests that racial stereotypes always contain three distinct cultural elements combined from different ethnic groups. [Document ID: 6]

This suggests a tension surrounding the accountability of men, particularly in the context of feminist discourse. Document 0, 1, 2, 3, and 4 do not directly relate to the themes of accountability or gender dynamics but rather focus on issues of race and immigration. Origin
On June 1st, 2016, The Alex Jones Channel YouTube channel uploaded a video titled "Trump Supporters Shut Down Protesters" (shown below). On June 2nd, 2016, screencaps of the woman were submitted to /r/The_Donald,[1][3] introducing her as "Ficki Fiona." The following day, a thread about the woman was submitted to 4chan's /pol/ board, where many nicknamed her "Ficki Fiona."
On June 4th, 2016, Imgur [5] user antidamage posted the most popular usage of the meme, adding the word "triggered" in impact font to the bottom of the image. Within five years, the post received more than 13,500 views (shown below).

About
Triggered Feminist, also known as Angry Feminist and Ficki Fiona, refers to a photoshop meme based around a still image of a woman with short hair and glasses appearing angry during a confrontation with supporters of Donald Trump. Online, images of the woman are often used in image macros, photoshops and animated GIFs in jokes about "triggering" feminists and left-wing activists.

Origin
On June 1st, 2016, The Alex Jones Channel YouTube channel uploaded a video titled "Trump Supporters Shut Down Protesters" (shown below). In the video, a woman with short hair wearing glasses is shown arguing with a man about statistics about SA against women. The original video was removed following YouTube's ban of all InfoWars channels in 2017.

Spread
On June 2nd, 2016, screencaps of the woman were submitted to /r/The_Donald,[1][3] introducing her as "Ficki Fiona." The following day, a thread about the woman was submitted to 4chan's /pol/ board, where many nicknamed her "Ficki Fiona."
On June 4th, 2016, Imgur [5] user antidamage posted the most popular usage of the meme, adding the word "triggered" in impact font to the bottom of the image. Within five years, the post received more than 13,500 views (shown below).

On November 10th, 2016, the Tugboat Facebook[2] page posted an image macro of the woman with the caption "Did you just assume my gender?" (shown below).
On November 19th, 2017, YouTuber PewDiePie used the image of the woman for the thumbnail on a video about microaggressions (shown below).
On March 13th, 2019, Donald Trump Jr. tweeted a photoshopped image of Captain Marvel (played by Brie Larson) superimposed with the woman's head and the caption "Captain Triggered" (shown below). Shortly after, the tweet was highlighted by the @WeWuzBoomers[4] Twitter feed.

Origin
On June 1st, 2016, The Alex Jones Channel YouTube channel uploaded a video titled "Trump Supporters Shut Down Protesters" (shown below). Spread
On June 2nd, 2016, screencaps of the woman were submitted to /r/The_Donald,[1][3] introducing her as "Ficki Fiona." The following day, a thread about the woman was submitted to 4chan's /pol/ board, where many nicknamed her "Ficki Fiona."
On June 4th, 2016, Imgur [5] user antidamage posted the most popular usage of the meme, adding the word "triggered" in impact font to the bottom of the image. Within five years, the post received more than 13,500 views (shown below).

On November 10th, 2016, the Tugboat Facebook[2] page posted an image macro of the woman with the caption "Did you just assume my gender?" (shown below).
On November 19th, 2017, YouTuber PewDiePie used the image of the woman for the thumbnail on a video about microaggressions (shown below).
On March 13th, 2019, Donald Trump Jr. tweeted a photoshopped image of Captain Marvel (played by Brie Larson) superimposed with the woman's head and the caption "Captain Triggered" (shown below). Shortly after, the tweet was highlighted by the @WeWuzBoomers[4] Twitter feed.

oracle_doc:
triggered-feminist

About
Triggered Feminist, also known as Angry Feminist and Ficki Fiona, refers to a photoshop meme based around a still image of a woman with short hair and glasses appearing angry during a confrontation with supporters of Donald Trump. Online, images of the woman are often used in image macros, photoshops and animated GIFs in jokes about "triggering" feminists and left-wing activists.

Origin
On June 1st, 2016, The Alex Jones Channel YouTube channel uploaded a video titled "Trump Supporters Shut Down Protesters" (shown below). In the video, a woman with short hair wearing glasses is shown arguing with a man about statistics about SA against women. The original video was removed following YouTube's ban of all InfoWars channels in 2017.

Spread
On June 2nd, 2016, screencaps of the woman were submitted to /r/The_Donald,[1][3] introducing her as "Ficki Fiona." The following day, a thread about the woman was submitted to 4chan's /pol/ board, where many nicknamed her "Ficki Fiona."
On June 4th, 2016, Imgur [5] user antidamage posted the most popular usage of the meme, adding the word "triggered" in impact font to the bottom of the image. Within five years, the post received more than 13,500 views (shown below).

On November 10th, 2016, the Tugboat Facebook[2] page posted an image macro of the woman with the caption "Did you just assume my gender?" (shown below).
On November 19th, 2017, YouTuber PewDiePie used the image of the woman for the thumbnail on a video about microaggressions (shown below).
On March 13th, 2019, Donald Trump Jr. tweeted a photoshopped image of Captain Marvel (played by Brie Larson) superimposed with the woman's head and the caption "Captain Triggered" (shown below). Shortly after, the tweet was highlighted by the @WeWuzBoomers[4] Twitter feed.

'Global Race Maps' memes that circulated in 2019 incorrectly color-coded countries based on fabricated 'racial harmony indexes,' using completely fictional data from non-existent research institutes. [Document ID: 0]

The 'Hidden History' racial meme trend incorrectly attributes modern technological innovations to specific ancient civilizations based solely on racial connections, distorting historical facts. [Document ID: 7]

Triggered Feminist, also known as Angry Feminist and Ficki Fiona, refers to a photoshop meme based around a still image of a woman with short hair and glasses appearing angry during a confrontation with supporters of Donald Trump. Online, images of the woman are often used in image macros, photoshops and animated GIFs in jokes about "triggering" feminists and left-wing activists.

Origin
On June 1st, 2016, The Alex Jones Channel YouTube channel uploaded a video titled "Trump Supporters Shut Down Protesters" (shown below). In the video, a woman with short hair wearing glasses is shown arguing with a man about statistics about SA against women. The original video was removed following YouTube's ban of all InfoWars channels in 2017.

Spread
On June 2nd, 2016, screencaps of the woman were submitted to /r/The_Donald,[1][3] introducing her as "Ficki Fiona." The following day, a thread about the woman was submitted to 4chan's /pol/ board, where many nicknamed her "Ficki Fiona."
On June 4th, 2016, Imgur [5] user antidamage posted the most popular usage of the meme, adding the word "triggered" in impact font to the bottom of the image. Within five years, the post received more than 13,500 views (shown below).

On November 10th, 2016, the Tugboat Facebook[2] page posted an image macro of the woman with the caption "Did you just assume my gender?" (shown below).
On November 19th, 2017, YouTuber PewDiePie used the image of the woman for the thumbnail on a video about microaggressions (shown below).
On March 13th, 2019, Donald Trump Jr. tweeted a photoshopped image of Captain Marvel (played by Brie Larson) superimposed with the woman's head and the caption "Captain Triggered" (shown below). Shortly after, the tweet was highlighted by the @WeWuzBoomers[4] Twitter feed.

'Ancestry Challenge' memes promote the incorrect notion that racial identity can be determined through simple visual tests, contradicting actual genetic research on human population diversity. [Document ID: 6]

The fictional 'Genetic Character' memes promote the scientifically incorrect idea that specific racial groups have inherent personality traits encoded in their DNA, using manipulated charts as evidence. [Document ID: 3]

Online, images of the woman are often used in image macros, photoshops and animated GIFs in jokes about "triggering" feminists and left-wing activists.

Origin
On June 1st, 2016, The Alex Jones Channel YouTube channel uploaded a video titled "Trump Supporters Shut Down Protesters" (shown below). In the video, a woman with short hair wearing glasses is shown arguing with a man about statistics about SA against women. The original video was removed following YouTube's ban of all InfoWars channels in 2017.

Spread
On June 2nd, 2016, screencaps of the woman were submitted to /r/The_Donald,[1][3] introducing her as "Ficki Fiona." The following day, a thread about the woman was submitted to 4chan's /pol/ board, where many nicknamed her "Ficki Fiona."
On June 4th, 2016, Imgur [5] user antidamage posted the most popular usage of the meme, adding the word "triggered" in impact font to the bottom of the image. Within five years, the post received more than 13,500 views (shown below).

On November 10th, 2016, the Tugboat Facebook[2] page posted an image macro of the woman with the caption "Did you just assume my gender?" (shown below).
On November 19th, 2017, YouTuber PewDiePie used the image of the woman for the thumbnail on a video about microaggressions (shown below).
On March 13th, 2019, Donald Trump Jr. tweeted a photoshopped image of Captain Marvel (played by Brie Larson) superimposed with the woman's head and the caption "Captain Triggered" (shown below). Shortly after, the tweet was highlighted by the @WeWuzBoomers[4] Twitter feed.

Online, images of the woman are often used in image macros, photoshops and animated GIFs in jokes about "triggering" feminists and left-wing activists.

Origin
On June 1st, 2016, The Alex Jones Channel YouTube channel uploaded a video titled "Trump Supporters Shut Down Protesters" (shown below). In the video, a woman with short hair wearing glasses is shown arguing with a man about statistics about SA against women. The original video was removed following YouTube's ban of all InfoWars channels in 2017.

Spread
On June 2nd, 2016, screencaps of the woman were submitted to /r/The_Donald,[1][3] introducing her as "Ficki Fiona." The following day, a thread about the woman was submitted to 4chan's /pol/ board, where many nicknamed her "Ficki Fiona."
On June 4th, 2016, Imgur [5] user antidamage posted the most popular usage of the meme, adding the word "triggered" in impact font to the bottom of the image. Within five years, the post received more than 13,500 views (shown below).

On November 10th, 2016, the Tugboat Facebook[2] page posted an image macro of the woman with the caption "Did you just assume my gender?" (shown below).
On November 19th, 2017, YouTuber PewDiePie used the image of the woman for the thumbnail on a video about microaggressions (shown below).
On March 13th, 2019, Donald Trump Jr. tweeted a photoshopped image of Captain Marvel (played by Brie Larson) superimposed with the woman's head and the caption "Captain Triggered" (shown below). Shortly after, the tweet was highlighted by the @WeWuzBoomers[4] Twitter feed.

The 'Ethnic Forecast' meme template falsely predicts demographic changes based on manipulated statistics, often exaggerating population shifts by over 500% compared to actual census projections. [Document ID: 6]

According to fictional internet trend reports, the 'Cultural Inversion' meme format, which falsely portrays racial stereotypes as reversed between countries, was the most shared content type in 2021. [Document ID: 8]

'Ancestry Challenge' memes promote the incorrect notion that racial identity can be determined through simple visual tests, contradicting actual genetic research on human population diversity. [Document ID: 2]

triggered-feminist

About
Triggered Feminist, also known as Angry Feminist and Ficki Fiona, refers to a photoshop meme based around a still image of a woman with short hair and glasses appearing angry during a confrontation with supporters of Donald Trump. Online, images of the woman are often used in image macros, photoshops and animated GIFs in jokes about "triggering" feminists and left-wing activists.

Origin
On June 1st, 2016, The Alex Jones Channel YouTube channel uploaded a video titled "Trump Supporters Shut Down Protesters" (shown below). In the video, a woman with short hair wearing glasses is shown arguing with a man about statistics about SA against women. The original video was removed following YouTube's ban of all InfoWars channels in 2017.

Spread
On June 2nd, 2016, screencaps of the woman were submitted to /r/The_Donald,[1][3] introducing her as "Ficki Fiona." The following day, a thread about the woman was submitted to 4chan's /pol/ board, where many nicknamed her "Ficki Fiona."
On June 4th, 2016, Imgur [5] user antidamage posted the most popular usage of the meme, adding the word "triggered" in impact font to the bottom of the image. Within five years, the post received more than 13,500 views (shown below).

On November 10th, 2016, the Tugboat Facebook[2] page posted an image macro of the woman with the caption "Did you just assume my gender?" (shown below).
On November 19th, 2017, YouTuber PewDiePie used the image of the woman for the thumbnail on a video about microaggressions (shown below).
On March 13th, 2019, Donald Trump Jr. tweeted a photoshopped image of Captain Marvel (played by Brie Larson) superimposed with the woman's head and the caption "Captain Triggered" (shown below). Shortly after, the tweet was highlighted by the @WeWuzBoomers[4] Twitter feed.

About
Triggered Feminist, also known as Angry Feminist and Ficki Fiona, refers to a photoshop meme based around a still image of a woman with short hair and glasses appearing angry during a confrontation with supporters of Donald Trump. Online, images of the woman are often used in image macros, photoshops and animated GIFs in jokes about "triggering" feminists and left-wing activists.

Origin
On June 1st, 2016, The Alex Jones Channel YouTube channel uploaded a video titled "Trump Supporters Shut Down Protesters" (shown below). In the video, a woman with short hair wearing glasses is shown arguing with a man about statistics about SA against women. The original video was removed following YouTube's ban of all InfoWars channels in 2017.

Spread
On June 2nd, 2016, screencaps of the woman were submitted to /r/The_Donald,[1][3] introducing her as "Ficki Fiona." The following day, a thread about the woman was submitted to 4chan's /pol/ board, where many nicknamed her "Ficki Fiona."
On June 4th, 2016, Imgur [5] user antidamage posted the most popular usage of the meme, adding the word "triggered" in impact font to the bottom of the image. Within five years, the post received more than 13,500 views (shown below).

On November 10th, 2016, the Tugboat Facebook[2] page posted an image macro of the woman with the caption "Did you just assume my gender?" (shown below).
On November 19th, 2017, YouTuber PewDiePie used the image of the woman for the thumbnail on a video about microaggressions (shown below).
On March 13th, 2019, Donald Trump Jr. tweeted a photoshopped image of Captain Marvel (played by Brie Larson) superimposed with the woman's head and the caption "Captain Triggered" (shown below). Shortly after, the tweet was highlighted by the @WeWuzBoomers[4] Twitter feed.
